wikipedia_page.main: Michael Howard Kay Ph.D FBCS (born 11 October 1951) is the editor of the W3C XSLT 2.0 and 3.0 language specifications for performing XML transformations, and the developer of the Saxon XSLT and XQuery processing software.

response: * Michael Howard Kay, British software developer
* Michael Howard Kay (born 1951), British XML developer

On retirement from the Atlas Laboratory, Howlett took up a post with ICL as founding editor of the ICL Technical Journal, a publication designed to give technical information about research and product innovation both inside the company and among its users and research partners. Peter Hall invited him to take this post in 1978Jack Howlett writing about his successor John Pinkerton in the ICL Technical Journal, vol 12 issue 2, p361 and he remained editor until 1990, thereafter continuing with an active role on the editorial board until his death; he thus had the unique distinction of receiving an ICL award for 21 years' service which only started at the age of 65.Michael Howard Kay, http://www.chilton-computing.org.uk/acl/associates/permanent/howlett/journal.htm He ran the meetings of the editorial board efficiently in the relaxed atmosphere of his London club, always followed by good food, wine, and conversation.
